Identity.History: The common zebra, or plains zebra as it is sometimes called is a very distinctive animal with its unique striped coat. In fact, a zebra’s coat is so unique that no two zebra’s have the same stripes. They can stand up to 5 feet high and weigh up 100 pounds. Herds of the common zebra lives across the plains northern Africa, where they often graze side by side with other peaceful animals.
